feed.subtitle: A simple, whitespace theme for academics. Based on [*folio](https://github.com/bogoli/-folio) design.

entry.title: Fake Unsplash Icon
entry.content:
Just for fun !

Source code can be found in CodePen

Layout is actually quite simple (check it out below üëáüèª). I just give it six same rectangulars which are placed in difference positions, and also a divider which is used to provide a little space between the upper part and bottom part.

Oh, rihgt, you might be curious about why I am using three separate rectangulars for the third row, instead of just filling it with all black. The reason I am doing this is simple as well, I just want to add some animations on this icon in the near future, and I believe it will be cool if each rectangular has its own animation.

The final looks like:

Three days later (04/27)‚Ä¶ I added some animations to make it display like it‚Äôs loading something.

‚ùóÔ∏è Again, just for fun, please don‚Äôt use it for any serious reason, expecially for making money. Thanks a lot :)

entry.title: An Alternative Way Installing Homebrew - Using Mirror

link.title: An Alternative Way Installing Homebrew - Using Mirror

entry.content:
1. Modify homebrew-related environment variables 
    export HOMEBREW_BREW_GIT_REMOTE="https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/git/homebrew/brew.git"
export HOMEBREW_CORE_GIT_REMOTE="https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/git/homebrew/homebrew-core.git"
export HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN="https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/homebrew-bottles"
  2. Install 
    /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install.sh)"
  3. Configuration 
    echo 'eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"' >> ~/.zprofile
eval "$(/opt/homebrew/bin/brew shellenv)"
entry.summary: Modify homebrew-related environment variables export HOMEBREW_BREW_GIT_REMOTE="https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/git/homebrew/brew.git" export HOMEBREW_CORE_GIT_REMOTE="https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/git/homebrew/homebrew-core.git" export HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN="https://mirrors.tuna.tsinghua.edu.cn/homebrew-bottles"

entry.title: Good Plugins / Tools can help Boost Productivity on iTerm2

link.title: Good Plugins / Tools can help Boost Productivity on iTerm2

entry.content:
This post is written based on the fact that you hava already had iTerm2 and Oh My ZSH installed.

Github icon created by Pixel perfect - Flaticon

1.Highlighting: ‚Äúprovides syntax highlighting for the shell zsh‚Äù ‚Äî zsh-syntax-highlighting

2.Auto suggestions: ‚Äúsuggests commands as you type based on history and completions‚Äù ‚Äî zsh-autosuggestions

3.Lazy Git: ‚ÄúA simple terminal UI for git commands‚Äù (Use it whether or no ! ) ‚Äì lazygit

4.The Logfile Navigator: ‚ÄúAn advanced log file viewer for the small-scale‚Äù ‚Äì lnav

5.Bat: ‚Äúsupports syntax highlighting for a large number of programming and markup languages‚Äù ‚Äì bat

6.Tree: ‚Äúproduces a depth indented listing of files‚Äù ‚Äì tree-cli
entry.summary: This post is written based on the fact that you hava already had iTerm2 and Oh My ZSH installed.
